Title: libpng: Multiple Denials of Service
Synopsis:
Several vulnerabilities in libpng may allow a remote attacker to crash
    applications that handle untrusted images.

Background.Text: libpng is a free ANSI C library used to process and manipulate PNG images.

Description.Text: An off-by-one error when handling ICC profile chunks in the png_set_iCCP() function was discovered (CVE-2007-5266). George Cook and Jeff Phillips reported several errors in pngrtran.c, the use of logical instead of a bitwise functions and incorrect comparisons (CVE-2007-5268). Tavis Ormandy reported out-of-bounds read errors in several PNG chunk handling functions (CVE-2007-5269).

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could craft an image that when processed or viewed by an application using libpng would cause the application to terminate abnormally.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.
